entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 3 (remake) (DS, 2006) (7)20130930
I played today for four and a half hours while flying and doubled
my total play time. I got to the Dark World and am exploring the
Cave of Tides. Exciting! I think I will upgrade my Warriors to
Knights.

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 3 (remake) (DS, 2006) (5)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 3 (remake) (DS, 2006) (5)20130927
I played for about an hour this morning. I made my way to the next
area with the Sea Dragon. I did a lot of grinding outside of the
cave and then decided to go in. I couldn't un-Mini myself to fight
the boss though, so it just creamed me. I guess I need to save a
casting of Mini for the battle. The game is very good... It's very
traditional but it has a lot of tightness that makes it a relaxing
grind.

Total time: 3:41
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy 3 (remake)
  • DS
  • 2006

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 3 (remake) (DS, 2006)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 3 (remake) (DS, 2006)20130921
I played for about forty minutes and just meandered
around... getting the first two characters and wandering around to
places where the enemies were way too hard. I haven't yet got jobs
and everything feels vaguely familiar, since I played the
beginning on NES, but still really different. I intend to continue
playing, although I'm quite lost. It seems like I should go into
the Mythril Mines, but everything is way too hard for me. I guess
I haven't explored the town enough... I just assumed there was
nothing except ghosts to find, but I really just looked in the
Magic and Blacksmith shops.

Total time: 0:42
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy 3 (remake)
  • DS
  • 2006

entry.title: Game: Lunar Knights (DS, 2007) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Lunar Knights (DS, 2007) (2)20130921
I played for about two hours today and beat two chapters. The gun
character is quite a bit different, but frustrating to control and
shoot things close to him. I also felt like the energy depleted
way too fast. In all the boss fights I've done, I've just gone
into Trance mode, spawned X, and won instantly. It's quite
boring. The loop in general isn't very fun. The space ship
segments are so weird that it is a nice divergence. I think I will
stop the game at Chapter 4.

Total time: 2:24
  • Video Games
  • Lunar Knights
  • DS
  • 2007

entry.title: Movie: Atonement, starring James McAvoy (2007)
entry.content:
Movie: Atonement, starring James McAvoy (2007)20130921
This was a touching movie with a lot of depth and subtlety. I
thought it was amazing that it was just about the repercussions of
a single day as shown through just a few other days. It was
interesting too that it is the story of Robbie and Cecilia but told
through the life of Brynly (or Brynny?). I very much enjoyed it.
  • Movies
  • 2007

entry.title: Movie: Safety Not Guaranteed, starring Aubrey Plaza (2012)
entry.content:
Movie: Safety Not Guaranteed, starring Aubrey Plaza (2012)20130920
This was a very sweet and understated movie. I liked each of the
plots and the gentle way it got towards the resolution. I think the
heist scene was the most hilarious part.
  • Movies
  • 2012

entry.title: Book: Lean In, by Sheryl Sandberg (2013)
entry.content:
Book: Lean In, by Sheryl Sandberg (2013)20130918
I started reading this book today. I don't have many comments. I do
find it a bit naive to assume that absolute equality is necessarily
a good thing and that there's no intrinsic reason for it. It is
particularly surprising for her to say it given that she claims
Larry Summers is a mentor.
  • Books
  • 2013

entry.title: Game: Jump Ultimate Stars (DS, 2006)
entry.content:
Game: Jump Ultimate Stars (DS, 2006)20130917
Like Bleach, I found this fighting game to be impenetrable on the
DS, although I could tell that there were some cool things about
it even though I didn't get past the tutorial. I imagine that if
you know all the characters it would be amazing.

entry.title: Game: Lunar Knights (DS, 2007)
entry.content:
Game: Lunar Knights (DS, 2007)20130917
I played this for a bit. It has an isometric world that reminds me
of Landstalker, except that it is not impossible to control. The
controls feel really sticky and blocky compared to something like
Link to the Past. But, I feel like it is worth a chance, so I'm
going to try it for a bit more. 

--

I played a bit later. I don't like the way it does tutorial
moments. I think the graphics are beautiful. The UI is a bit
squeezed for my taste.

I finished the first chapter. The gameplay hasn't really changed a
lot. I get the impression I will get through it pretty quickly, so
I am still optimistic about enjoying it. I think the world is
really bizarre... it's a futuristic vampire anime world. Very odd.

Total time: 1:19
  • Video Games
  • Lunar Knights
  • DS
  • 2007
